reviewText:
In its current state, this game is not worth getting. There are several modes, but not really anything to do in most. You'll be lucky to squeeze 1-2 hours out of it. The multiplayer mode is useless, as there are never any lobbies open. You can create one, but no one is ever online to play. Additionally, the performance is poor. Alone on a multiplayer map with graphics on 'Fastest' I get marginally better FPS than Battlefield 3 with 64 players on Intel graphics. The guns feel and sound weak, though they are vastly improved from the single player guns. The controls can be painfully awkward and are not rebindable. To quit multiplayer I have to Alt+Tab and close it as I cannot find an option to return to the menu or quit the game.  Finally, the Grass Simulating mode has the worst graphics of any mode, featuring 2D 'sprites' rather than 3D models of grass (this is most noticeable with the green silhouette of corn.)

Despite the updates the game has received, essentially no significant improvements to individual modes have been made as far as I can tell. New modes get added, and nothing gets fixed. Despite a HUD and all guns being fully animated in multiplayer, the single player modes still have unfinished animations for guns and no hud at all.

Perhaps someday, if the dev is willing to fix and expand existing modes instead of randomly adding new ones, the game may end up ok. However, until that day comes I advise you stay clear of Grass Simulator.\

V0.2.1 Update:
Just performance fixes and maybe(?) some bugfixes. No new content. Multiplayer still ugly and empty (fun fact: it's impossible to use up all your ammo in a match.)  At least if you now find yourself playing Grass Simulator it will run better.

V0.2.2 Update:
MAIN MENU BUG FINALLY FIXED. You can properly change game modes now. Unless you start multiplayer, then you have to restart the game. :/
New mode, Hellfire, replaced the 'Grass' mode. It's effectively 'Classic' mode but with f.lux set to darkroom and some reskinned guns. Also, and I believe this is new in this version, weapon recoil is more severe. Weirdly, only the gun model moves-your bullets still go to the same spot and the camera fails to move, creating a weird look. I noticed the Glock sounds like it has a suppressor in Hellfire mode, and Classic, Hellfire [and I assume Snowfall as well] now have infinite ammo for all guns. The infinite ammo was implemented incorrectly, however, and you now never need to reload. Cow hit boxes are wrong as well.

While it was nice to see an update that actually addressed problems and attempted to add 'new' content, I still cannot recommend this game to anyone.

reviewText:
After an intense, fun filled 76 hours of me, the sky, grass, and cows. I can surely say that this is one heck of a game. The story seems to be a bit linear, I believe that if the community gives ideas, we can make the game bigger and better. We cannot leave a game as beautifully crafted as this be left a waste.

I guess I'll go through all the game modes:

Classic Mode
Well this is the firstmode I started out with and oh boy, did the plot move quickly. Fast paced and totally bonkers. This is the game mode I had the most fun with and honestly I don't think this mode needs much improvement. It's good as it is.

Dubstep Cow Mode
A pretty meh game mode. I feel as if they just wanted to jump on the whole Dubstep mainstream bandwagon. I'm not saying its all bad, its enjoyable. Pretty entertaining. Although I do feel, even without this game mode, the game would still be amazing. This is also my least played mode, due to me just not liking it much.

Grass Simulation Mode
Wow. That's all I can really say. This is stunning. Never have I ever thought of what it's like being grass. This is truly breath taking and I really feel like I'm in tune with my own lawn! It's really astonishing, how much the developers put so much work into making this a true next gen experience. The graphics seemed to have been pushed to the limits on this mode. I really didn't expect much from this game, but golly, was I wrong assuming this was going to be bad. This is a really innovative game mode and I just sometimes play it in order to feel being grass. I used to spend my weekends sitting mournfully on my windowsill as my friends played out in the fields.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI wanted to make this review short and sweet, but it's hard to stop writing, even when excluding facts that could potentially contaminate an exceptionally well thought-out gaming experience. There's just so much to say.Grass Simulator is, simply put, the best single-player games ever released for the PC. It does so many things right in so many ways that it might be possible to write a thesis on the topic of Grass Simulator compared to other games. What Daniel Davies has created is simply a masterpiece -- a work of art in the genre. Not only does it engage the mind with mysterious happenings, vagaries, and mostly intelligent dialogue, but also captures the senses with a superb visual style made possible by brilliant technology. And once the initial shock of it all wears off and it becomes possible to peel back the polished layers of sight and sound, there is an excellent FPS here. Grass Simulator doesn't do anything particularly new; it doesn't really innovate in many ways. But what it does is set a new height for all other designers of video games to reach. It still isn't exactly perfect, but it's about as close as I've seen.

Sure it's not Skyrim, GTA5, or Fallout 4, but this game has a lot of potential, especially in multiplayer.

Positives:

• Cheap, especially when it's on sale.
• Decent graphics. And the game runs great at the lowest graphics option (which honestly is pretty much the same as the highest graphics option.)
• Guns on singleplayer have unlimited ammo yet still have a reload animation
• Cool environments.
• Next-gen physics
• Multiplayer is fun
• Hands down the best grass simulation game on the market

Negatives:

• Occasional graphical glitches
• Cows can't be killed on multiplayer
• There's no real point to some game modes

Overall I give it 8/10 highly recommended.
